snippet: Public service work can be a gateway to careers and gives new graduates time to consider options and learn about themselves.
abstract: Eilene Zimmerman Career Couch column contends public service work can be a gateway to a career and can give new graduates time to consider options and learn about themselves. Drawing (M)
lead_paragraph: Q.You are a new college graduate without a job or concrete career plans. You might be interested in doing public service work for a year or two. Could that help you find your way to a career? A. Public service work for organizations like AmeriCorps, Teach for America or the Peace Corps can be a gateway to a variety of careers, including those outside public service.

headline.main: A Gateway To a Career Through Volunteering
